results.title: Harvesting the snows
results.brief_description: Surveys the Snowy Mountains Scheme - largest engineering project ever undertaken in Australia at the time. Outlines the plan for diverting the waters of the Snowy to the Murray. Shows the Guthega Dam and power station; construction in the Guthega Munyang tunnel; the plan for the [new] Adaminaby Dam and early stages of its construction.

results.title: Harvesting
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Guy L. Cote, Marcel Martin and Arthur Lamothe
results.brief_description: A visual poem about the wheat harvest on the vast Canadian prairies. Here, reality is horizon-wide fields of grain that must be cut and threshed by the combines before frost lays the crop to waste. The images suggest a strange but magnificent military maneuver as a phalanx of giant machines lumbers across the golden acres.

results.title: Harvest time
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine newsreel items including: 1. Ten Thousand Eggs a Day: A big pie-shaped henhouse in Nova Scotia produces eggs with assembly-line regularity. 2. Harvest on the Vine: A look at the Niagara wine industry shows how grapes are pressed and processed into Canadian wine. 3. Follow That Sheep: At Kamloops, British Columbia, a trek to the mountains with seven thousand sheep and two canny sheep dogs.

results.title: Harvest of the gulfs
results.creator_credit: Motion Picture Associates, South Australian Film Corporation, Peter Dimond and John Leake
results.brief_description: This film traces the research being undertaken by the South Australian Department of Fisheries into the life cycle, habitat and movements of the Western King Prawn in the South Australian gulf waters.

results.title: Harvest for tomorrow - Venezuela
results.creator_credit: Shell Film Unit and Lionel Cole
results.brief_description: Venezuela is investing the wealth obtained from petroleum production to further the development of her country. A large percentage of her foreign earnings come from oil, and the Government has embarked on a policy of using profits derived from oil to finance schemes of soil and water conservation, technical education, housing, road construction, scientific research and the mechanization of agriculture to further improve the standard of living for her people. Music by Edmundo Ros.

results.title: Harvest at Nong Lub
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, John Morris, Thanom Soongnarata and Brian Hannant
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Thailand”.
Without intruding, an Australian camera crew lives with a Thai family during the rice harvest. The comings and goings, the hard work, the moments of relaxation, the dreams and also the aspirations are briefly held in the hope of understanding the differences in life and the similarities in being

results.title: Harvest
results.creator_credit: U.S.A Department of Agriculture and Carroll Ballard
results.brief_description: Farming in the United States: with the population increase more food must be produced even though more land is being taken up for city and urban expansion. The student population is increasing in universities and agricultural colleges where the study of the sciences associated with modern farming are undergoing rapid change. This leads to a reduction of farm problems and bigger yields with the aid of new chemicals and mechanical implements. However, the farmer is still at the mercy of the weather. Culminates in a harvest sequence.

results.title: Harum scarum
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Sam Katzman and Gene Nelson
results.brief_description: The King’s 19th movie is shot on the original 1925 Cecil B DeMille set from “King of Kings” and features Elvis as matinee idol Johnny Tyrone. When Tyrone is kidnapped en route to the Middle Eastern premier of his latest film, he is launched into an Arabian Nights scenario, complete with chicks, sheikhs, a hostile political environment, and the obligatory damsel in distress (Mary Ann Mobley). He is also asked to take part in a plot to assassinate an Arab king. Features nine songs including “Harem holiday”, “Golden coins”, “Shake that tambourine” and “Go East young man”. Cast also includes Fran Jeffries, Michael Ansara and Jay Novello. The film is alleged to have been made within 18 days.

results.title: Harry, he is here to help = Harry, un ami qui vous veut du bien
results.creator_credit: Diaphana Films, Michel Saint-Jean and Dominik Moll
results.brief_description: Described as black comedy “Harry, he is here to help” is a taut serial killer thriller, “Hitchcockian” in tone. Sergi Lopez plays Harry, a wealthy man of independent means, given to acts of largesse, who runs into an old school chum, Michel, in the lavatory of a service station. Michel, married with three daughters, is in financial straits with a country family retreat that is in essence a money pit. Recalling Michel’s juvenile high school poetry, and believing that Michel has lost his artistic drive due to domestic demands, Harry insinuates himself in order to ‘fix’ Michel’s life. Harry, a handsome, sexually avaricious and amiable sociopath, is capable of a seemingly ceaseless slew of deaths in his determination to enable Michel to fulfill artistic aspirations. The friendly fiendish stranger, who poses a threat to the nuclear family, is familiar in cinema, driving such films as “Strangers on a train” and “Fatal attraction”. Moll offers few fresh insights into such narrative ploys other than proffering a spin in regards to Michel’s suppressed art, and the homoeroticism of the male lead, as he eliminates the perilous reproducers - the female presence. Cast includes: Laurent Lucas, Sergi Lopez, Mathilde Seigner, Sophie Guillemin, Liliane Rovere, Dominique Rozan.
